## Description {#details}

A description of a memory reference used in the backend.

Instead of holding a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/storeinst">StoreInst</a> or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a>, this class holds the address <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> of the reference along with a byte size and offset. This allows it to describe lowered loads and stores. Also, the special <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pseudosourcevalue">PseudoSourceValue</a> objects can be used to represent loads and stores to memory locations that aren&#39;t explicit in the regular LLVM IR.

Definition at line 129 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinememoperand-h">MachineMemOperand.h</a>.

### enum  {#aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>enum llvm::MachineMemOperand::Flags : uint16&#95;t</>}>
<a href="#aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dd">Flags</a> values. These may be or&#39;d together.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2ddac2989bebe46c9b9fcb7a92e5ade8dde6" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MONone">
 (= 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dda7d12be6206e5b0026c71bbcd5cb76494" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MOLoad">
The memory access reads data (= 1u &lt;&lt; 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2ddaed357b1367bc90a56fefa4d1b0e17374" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MOStore">
The memory access writes data (= 1u &lt;&lt; 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dda796891d6ca349b671fce24b6d01d77a8" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MOVolatile">
The memory access is volatile (= 1u &lt;&lt; 2)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dda8d09c51969b0954512ed65ee26551081" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MONonTemporal">
The memory access is non-temporal (= 1u &lt;&lt; 3)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dda7b999a936bc7a4d45dfadbe356e77b3f" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MODereferenceable">
The memory access is dereferenceable (i.e., doesn&#39;t trap) (= 1u &lt;&lt; 4)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2ddac63dd9c4fe69bfeaac7a363fda846ac6" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MOInvariant">
The memory access always returns the same value (or traps) (= 1u &lt;&lt; 5)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2ddace83cf304d65cdb6b3b22cc485eed877" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MOTargetFlag1">
 (= 1u &lt;&lt; 6)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dda036efcf0f4eac932646d211f480528c3" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MOTargetFlag2">
 (= 1u &lt;&lt; 7)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2ddad7c78ebdd6e4c475178f5ca950914f33" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MOTargetFlag3">
 (= 1u &lt;&lt; 8)

<EnumerationListItem name="MOTargetFlag4">
 (= 1u &lt;&lt; 9)

  prototype={<>MachineMemOperand::MachineMemOperand (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> PtrInfo, <a href="#aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dd">Flags</a> flags, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/locationsize">LocationSize</a> TS, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> a, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aamdnodes">AAMDNodes</a> &amp; AAInfo=<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aamdnodes">AAMDNodes</a>(), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a> &#42; Ranges=nullptr, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/syncscope/#a80741d3f96133391b683effd8e5b77f0">SyncScope::ID</a> SSID=<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/syncscope/#a15caddcf5c9b41f2f15c2ec363589f6caf9706a2e196638078e8323bfd9ba17de">SyncScope::System</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7">AtomicOrdering</a> Ordering=<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a56a57d29a3f9dda8671b4d6490a94b08">AtomicOrdering::NotAtomic</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7">AtomicOrdering</a> FailureOrdering=<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a56a57d29a3f9dda8671b4d6490a94b08">AtomicOrdering::NotAtomic</a>)</>}>
Construct a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinememoperand">MachineMemOperand</a> object with the specified PtrInfo, flags, size, and base alignment.

For atomic operations the synchronization scope and atomic ordering requirements must also be specified. For cmpxchg atomic operations the atomic ordering requirements when store does not occur must also be specified.

### getValue() {#add9e6ff8fe1923cb64757a6dbcd61676}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Value &#42; llvm::MachineMemOperand::getValue () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the base address of the memory access.

This may either be a normal LLVM IR <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>, or one of the special values used in CodeGen. Special values are those obtained via PseudoSourceValue::getFixedStack(int), PseudoSourceValue::getStack, and other <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pseudosourcevalue">PseudoSourceValue</a> member functions which return objects which stand for frame/stack pointer relative references and other special references which are not representable in the high-level IR.

### refineAlignment() {#a6cf00cf755c1275eba246de7ebf7842d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MachineMemOperand::refineAlignment (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinememoperand">MachineMemOperand</a> &#42; MMO)</>}>
Update this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinememoperand">MachineMemOperand</a> to reflect the alignment of MMO, if it has a greater alignment.

### setFlags() {#aadac6e7fd2d1087b6489906659bb8afb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::MachineMemOperand::setFlags (<a href="#aaa2020e47e35179234b9ea27d555b2dd">Flags</a> f)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>

### MemoryType {#ac53f28dce8545babee163faa4225d232}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="LLT llvm::MachineMemOperand::MemoryType">
Track the memory type of the access.

An access size which is unknown or too large to be represented by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> should use the invalid <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a>.
